name: Puzzle Station 15th Anniversary Retro Release
description: Puzzle Station offers two game modes. Arcade Mode is a fast paced and more casual and the Puzzle Mode offers hand crafted puzzles, which will require more planning ahead.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP/7 Processor: 1GHz Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: DirectX 7.0 compatible DirectX: Version 7.0 Storage: 43 MB available space Sound Card: DirectX 7.0 compatible Additional Notes: No game controller support

reviews.review_text: I remember playing this game when I was a kid. It's still fun to play and while it's a short game, I feel like it's worth the price at least for fans of puzzle games. It's not a long game though and not very hard either.  The game worked fine but as others have said the resolution is locked and it crashed when I tried Alt-Tabbing out of it. However it doesn't take many seconds to quit and restart and it saves between each level.
